pages.text: A fortress can't be made in a day. For now, I should focus on something that will keep me safe during my first few days. I could find a naturally defensible area, like a mountainside or a cave, or try to build up a walled shelter. If I try to shelter somewhere that's too small or too bright, I'm sure to end up as something's dinner.

A structure or wall made of cobblestone from all sides should be enough to get me through the first few nights. I have noticed creatures that hold pickaxes can break hard materials like stone. Those seem to be pretty rare, so I should be mostly safe. If I want to be extra safe, I could smelt the cobblestone and then craft it into $(item)stone bricks$() for increased protection.
